00018 /*
00019  * Comments and Questions about this draft.
00020  *
00021  * 1. This draft only includes the definition of the methods supplied by Sync
00022  *    and required by Sync.
00023  * 2. There is no creation method defined in this interface, details TBD.
00024  * 3. We assume that the charbuf definition is the common CCN one.
00025  * 4. The methods that can be NULL are there to provide access to a local Repo
00026  *    for faster and more efficient access.  If they are NULL then any content
00027  *    access must go through the normal CCN interfaces.
00028  * 5. It might be a good idea to provide some way to access configuration or
00029  *    tuning parameters for Sync.  Right now those come through env variables.
00030  */
00031 
00032 #ifndef CCN_SyncDepends
00033 #define CCN_SyncDepends
00034 
00035 #include <sys/types.h>
00036 #include <ccn/ccn.h>
00037 #include <ccn/charbuf.h>
00038 
00039 struct sync_plumbing;           // forward def
00040 struct sync_plumbing_sync_methods;   // forward def
00041 struct sync_plumbing_client_methods; // forward def
00042 
00043 struct sync_plumbing {
00044     struct ccn *ccn;                // ccn handle to share
00045     struct ccn_schedule *sched;     // scheduler to share
00046     
00047     // sync data and methods
00048     void *sync_data;
00049     struct sync_plumbing_sync_methods *sync_methods;
00050     
00051     // client data and methods
00052     void *client_data;
00053     struct sync_plumbing_client_methods *client_methods;
00054     
00055 };
00056 
00057 struct sync_plumbing_sync_methods {
00058     // call to start sync processing
00059     // state_buf holds recovery data (from last sync_stop)
00060     // returns < 0 if a failure occurred
00061     // returns 0 if the name updates should fully restart
00062     // returns > 0 if the name updates should restart at last fence
00063     int (* sync_start)(struct sync_plumbing *sd,
00064                        struct ccn_charbuf *state_buf);
00065     
00066     // call to add a name to the sync trees
00067     // from r_sync_enumerate (if enum_index > 0)
00068     // or from the name updates (if enum_index == 0)
00069     //    (for name updates, the seq_num can be used to set the fence)
00070     // if (name == NULL), marks the end of enumeration
00071     // returns < 0 to indicate an error, and terminate the enumeration
00072     // returns 0 if the name was not used
00073     // returns > 0 if the name was used
00074     int (* sync_notify)(struct sync_plumbing *sd,
00075                         struct ccn_charbuf *name,
00076                         int enum_index,
00077                         uint64_t seq_num);
00078     
00079     // call to stop sync processing (and return resources)
00080     // state_buf holds recovery data (for next sync_start)
00081     void (* sync_stop)(struct sync_plumbing *sd,
00082                        struct ccn_charbuf *state_buf);
00083 };
00084 
00085 struct sync_plumbing_client_methods {
00086     // logging facility
00087     void (* r_sync_msg)(struct sync_plumbing *sd,
00088                         const char *fmt, ...);
00089     
00090     // sets a fence for repo-style recovery (see below),
00091     // where the fence is set no later than the seq_num
00092     // returns < 0 for an error
00093     // returns >= 0 for success
00094     // method is NULL if fence not supported
00095     int (* r_sync_fence)(struct sync_plumbing *sd,
00096                          uint64_t seq_num);
00097     
00098     // starts a name enumeration (via sync_notify), returns immediately
00099     // returns < 0 for an error
00100     // returns 0 if no names match the interest (optional)
00101     // returns an enumeration index > 0 if successful
00102     // (index will be passed to sync_notify)
00103     // method is NULL if no local enumeration
00104     int (* r_sync_enumerate)(struct sync_plumbing *sd,
00105                              struct ccn_charbuf *interest);
00106     
00107     // lookup interest locally (no pause)
00108     // returns < 0 for an error or not present, >= 0 if fetched
00109     // if (content != NULL), fills content with the signed content object
00110     // method is NULL if no local lookup
00111     int (* r_sync_lookup)(struct sync_plumbing *sd,
00112                           struct ccn_charbuf *interest,
00113                           struct ccn_charbuf *content);
00114     
00115     // stores signed content (no pause)
00116     // returns < 0 for an error
00117     // returns 0 if already stored (or is in progress)
00118     // returns > 0 if newly stored
00119     // method is NULL if no local store
00120     int (* r_sync_local_store)(struct sync_plumbing *sd,
00121                                struct ccn_charbuf *content);
00122     
00123     // stores signed content (no pause) from inside a content handler
00124     // returns < 0 for an error
00125     // returns 0 if already stored (or is in progress)
00126     // returns > 0 if newly stored
00127     // method is NULL if no local store
00128     enum ccn_upcall_res (* r_sync_upcall_store)(struct sync_plumbing *sd,
00129                                                 enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
00130                                                 struct ccn_upcall_info *info);
00131 };
00132 
00133 /*
00134  * Intended use of Sync, Repo, and the fence.
00135  *
00136  * A call to r_sync_fence sets a "fence" marker that is remembered for any
00137  * clean shut down of a repo/sync pair.
00138  
00139  When the repo starts up after a clean shutdown then
00140  // the repo will call sync_notify with names for objects that were stored
00141  // no later than the last fence operation executed before the shut down
00142  // (this ensures that no names will be missed when updating the sync trees)
00143  // It is intended that Sync calls fence whenever all collections are stable,
00144  // which menas that no collections have pending names.  Since this may not 
00145  */
00146 
00147 #endif
